title: JupyterLab Uncontrolled Search Path Element Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of JupyterLab. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system in order to exploit this vulnerability. Additionally, the vulnerability is triggered only when a target user makes use of the product.
The specific flaw exists within the jupyter-lab process. The process loads a configuration script from an unsecured location. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to escalate privileges and execute arbitrary code in the context of a target user.
addtionnal_details: Jupyter has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://github.com/jupyter/jupyter_core/security/advisories/GHSA-33p9-3p43-82vq
timeline:
2025-02-13 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2025-06-10 - Coordinated public release of advisory
2025-06-10 - Advisory Updated
